MyCovertChannel module

class MyCovertChannel.MyCovertChannel[source]

Bases: CovertChannelBase

Implements a covert channel communication system.

Notes

  • You are not allowed to change the file name and class name.

  • You can edit the class in any way you want (e.g., adding helper functions).

  • The class must include send and receive methods, which trigger the covert channel.

receive(log_file_name, limit)[source]

Receives a covert message by decoding data from Ethernet packets.

Steps:

  • Sniff packets with the specified Ethernet protocol.

  • Decode the ctrl field:

    • If ctrl > limit: decode as 0.

    • Otherwise, decode as 1.

  • Convert every 8 bits into a character and append to the received message.

  • Stop processing when a period (“.”) is received.

Parameters:

  • log_file_name (str) – Name of the log file to record the received message.

  • limit (int) – Threshold value for decoding the control (ctrl) field.

Returns:

None

send(log_file_name, limit, dest_mac, source_mac)[source]

Sends a covert message by encoding data into Ethernet packets.

Steps:

  • Create a random binary message.

  • Encode each bit using the control (ctrl) field:

    • If bit is 1: ctrl ∈ [0, limit]

    • If bit is 0: ctrl ∈ (limit, 255]

  • Construct Ethernet/LLC packets using the specified source and destination MAC addresses.

  • Wait 50ms between each packet transmission.

Parameters:

  • log_file_name (str) – Name of the log file to record the sent message.

  • limit (int) – Threshold value for splitting the control (ctrl) field.

  • dest_mac (str) – Destination MAC address for the Ethernet layer.

  • source_mac (str) – Source MAC address for the Ethernet layer.

Returns:

None

Source Code

  1import random
  2import time
  3
  4from CovertChannelBase import CovertChannelBase
  5from scapy.all import Ether, Raw, sniff
  6from scapy.layers.l2 import LLC
  7
  8
  9class MyCovertChannel(CovertChannelBase):
 10    """
 11    Implements a covert channel communication system.
 12
 13    Notes:
 14        - You are not allowed to change the file name and class name.
 15        - You can edit the class in any way you want (e.g., adding helper functions).
 16        - The class must include `send` and `receive` methods, which trigger the covert channel.
 17    """
 18
 19    def __init__(self):
 20        """
 21        Initializes the `MyCovertChannel` class.
 22
 23        Notes:
 24            - You can edit this method to set up any required state or configurations.
 25        """
 26        pass
 27
 28    def send(self, log_file_name, limit, dest_mac, source_mac):
 29        """
 30        Sends a covert message by encoding data into Ethernet packets.
 31
 32        Steps:
 33            - Create a random binary message.
 34            - Encode each bit using the control (`ctrl`) field:
 35                * If bit is 1: `ctrl` ∈ [0, limit]
 36                * If bit is 0: `ctrl` ∈ (limit, 255]
 37            - Construct Ethernet/LLC packets using the specified source and destination MAC addresses.
 38            - Wait 50ms between each packet transmission.
 39
 40        Parameters:
 41            log_file_name (str): Name of the log file to record the sent message.
 42            limit (int): Threshold value for splitting the control (`ctrl`) field.
 43            dest_mac (str): Destination MAC address for the Ethernet layer.
 44            source_mac (str): Source MAC address for the Ethernet layer.
 45
 46        Returns:
 47            None
 48        """
 49        binary_message = self.generate_random_binary_message_with_logging(
 50            log_file_name, min_length=16, max_length=16
 51        )
 52
 53        eth_layer = Ether(dst=dest_mac, src=source_mac, type=0xAAAA)
 54
 55        for bit in binary_message:
 56            if bit == "1":
 57                ctrl = random.randint(0, limit)
 58            elif bit == "0":
 59                ctrl = random.randint(limit + 1, 255)
 60
 61            dsap = random.randint(0, 255)
 62            ssap = random.randint(0, 255)
 63            llc_layer = LLC(dsap=dsap, ssap=ssap, ctrl=ctrl)
 64            packet = eth_layer / llc_layer
 65            super().send(packet)
 66            time.sleep(0.05)
 67
 68    def receive(self, log_file_name, limit):
 69        """
 70        Receives a covert message by decoding data from Ethernet packets.
 71
 72        Steps:
 73            - Sniff packets with the specified Ethernet protocol.
 74            - Decode the `ctrl` field:
 75                * If `ctrl` > limit: decode as 0.
 76                * Otherwise, decode as 1.
 77            - Convert every 8 bits into a character and append to the received message.
 78            - Stop processing when a period (`"."`) is received.
 79
 80        Parameters:
 81            log_file_name (str): Name of the log file to record the received message.
 82            limit (int): Threshold value for decoding the control (`ctrl`) field.
 83
 84        Returns:
 85            None
 86        """
 87        received_msg = ""
 88        bits = ""
 89        bit_count = 0
 90        leave = False
 91        while True:
 92            packet = sniff(iface="eth0", filter="ether proto 0xaaaa", count=1)
 93            pkt = packet[0]
 94            llc = LLC(pkt[Raw].load)
 95
 96            if llc.ctrl > limit:
 97                bits += "0"
 98            else:
 99                bits += "1"
100
101            bit_count += 1
102
103            if bit_count == 8:
104                bit_count = 0
105                ch = self.convert_eight_bits_to_character(bits)
106                received_msg += ch
107                bits = ""
108
109                if ch == ".":
110                    leave = True
111                    break
112            if leave:
113                break
114        self.log_message(received_msg, log_file_name)
